revision.text:
Founded in 1989, '''Diversified Project Management''' is a [[New England]]-based owners’ representative consulting company headquartered in [[Newton, Massachusetts]]. With additional offices in [[Hartford, Connecticut]], and [[Stamford, Connecticut]], Diversified Project Management specializes in programming, [[project management]], [[construction management|construction administration]], [[Furniture, Fixtures and Equipment|FF&E coordination]] and move-planning services for corporate, education, health care, manufacturing and biotechnology construction, renovation and relocation projects.
==Management team==
* Robert M. Keeley, Jr., president * Philip Leonard, vice president of operations * Bill Clegg, Vice President of Operations * Mark DuPre, ASHE, Assoc. AIA, Vice President & Project Executive * John A. Waitkunas, Vice President & project executive * Greg Lewis, Vice President, R&D Market segment leader * Carolyn Hern, director of business development * Alicia Lawless, communications manager
==History== Diversified Project Management established its [[Boston]] office in 1989, with the mission of providing objective tenant representation, project programming, construction administration, facilities management and move coordination services. Diversified Project Management later founded its Hartford office in 1996 to better serve the Hartford, [[New Haven]] and [[Western Massachusetts]] markets. In 2007, Diversified Project Management added its Stamford location, serving [[Fairfield County, Connecticut|Fairfield]] and [[Westchester County, New York|Westchester]] counties in Connecticut and New York. Diversified Project Management has since opened an office in Providence, Rhode Island.
==Industries==
===Academic=== Diversified provided move management services for the convert|170000|sqft|m2|sing=on Life Sciences Facility at [[Brown University]]. This research center houses the departments of molecular biology, cellular biology and biochemistry and neuroscience. With 60 new laboratories, the project modernized the departments and expanded laboratory and research capacity at Brown by 50 percent. It was designed to encourage scientific collaboration among faculty; staff and students by uniting complementary research under one roof.<ref>{{Cite web | url= http://www.brown.edu/Administration/George_Street_Journal/vol28/28GSJ03a.html | title= George Street Journal: Construction and Renovation Projects Generate New Academic Space | accessdate= 2008-03-25 | deadurl= yes | archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20060919115229/http://www.brown.edu/Administration/George_Street_Journal/vol28/28GSJ03a.html | archivedate= 2006-09-19 | df= }}</ref>
===Corporate=== Diversified managed the corporate relocation project for [[CVS Caremark Corporation|CVS]] into their {{convert|217000|sqft|m2|sing=on}} Support Center Expansion space in [[Woonsocket, Rhode Island]]. The multi-phased relocation management was broken into three projects focusing on moving employees into the new space, relocation into the vacated and renovated existing space and bringing staff in from various CVS facilities in the surrounding areas. Over 1,000 staff members were moved in the process. Along with master timeline generation and overall move management services, DPM oversaw the furniture knockdown/reconfiguration and installation of new systems.
===Healthcare=== Diversified was hired to centralize [[Partners HealthCare| Partners HealthCare's]] finance department, by consolidating seven offices into {{convert|200000|sqft|m2}} of space on two-and-a-half floors at [[Schrafft's|the Schrafft Center]], in [[Charlestown, Massachusetts]]. The project scope included programming and move management for approximately 800 people.
===High tech and industrial=== [[MRO Software]] retained Diversified for the renovation of {{convert|100000|sqft|m2}} of office space and relocation of over 300 employees in [[Bedford, Massachusetts]]. Diversified's responsibilities included overall project management, design development coordination, general contractor selection and administration, value engineering, voice and data coordination, furniture selection and management and move planning. Diversified acted as MRO's representative.
Diversified was retained to manage [[Acme Packet| Acme Packet's]] office and lab build out and relocation. Acme Packet relocated from their single, floor office space in Woburn to a new two-story state-of-the-art building in Burlington, where they nearly doubled in size to {{convert|43061|sqft|m2}} of space as the sole tenant. The move involved 84 staff members, 60 workstations, manufacturing areas and a test lab.
===Non-profit=== Jewish Family & Children's Services Diversified was retained to provide project management for Jewish Family & Children's Services relocation to a {{convert|40000|sqft|m2|sing=on}} building in [[Waltham, Massachusetts]]. The move involved 120 employees from two separate locations in Newton and Boston.
===Pharmaceutical and biotech=== [[Eisai]] Research Institute Diversified managed the relocation for 120 employees into a{{convert|180000|sqft|m2|adj=on}} laboratory and office in [[Andover, Massachusetts]]. The project included renovating and expanding building four on the Andover campus to include more office space and the addition of an elevator and stairway. Simultaneously, building five on the campus was demolished to make way for the construction of a new {{convert|180000|sqft|m2|sing=on}} office and laboratory building. A connector was built between building four and the new building to facilitate easy access between the buildings for company personnel.
===Public, municipal, and state governments=== Diversified managed the relocation of the [[United States Coast Guard]] from its facility located at the [[University of Connecticut]] campus at Avery Point in [[Groton, Connecticut]]. Diversified oversaw the entire {{convert|60000|sqft|m2|sing=on}} project from the evaluation and selection of a new property to the coordination of the move into the new space. The office facility is designed for 170 employees and 10-percent of the real estate was designed as research lab space.
==References== <references/>
==External links== * [http://www.dpm-inc.com/ Diversified Project Management]
[[Category:Construction organizations]] [[Category:Building engineering]]

revision.text:
{{unreferenced|date=November 2017}} The '''Ducks demo''' was a [[tech demo]] that demonstrated the capabilities of the [[PlayStation 2]] at [[Electronic Entertainment Expo|E3]] 2000 and the [[PlayStation 3]] at E3 2005. In the PlayStation 2 demo, only one duck is shown interacting with the water in the bathtub. In the PlayStation 3 demo, there are many ducks interacting with each other and their environment, as a visual representation of the leap in processing abilities from the PlayStation 2 Sony executives promise the PlayStation 3 will deliver. The Ducks demo was the basis for ''[[Super Rub 'a' Dub]]'' which is a downloadable title for the PS3 produced by SCEE.
== The 2005 Demo ==
In the demo, [[Phil Harrison]] shows the crowd a small bathtub with some [[rubber duck]]s in it. He uses these to demonstrate the real-time water ripples and dynamics. He then uses two toy pirate ships to demonstrate cloth dynamics. To show the [[Cell (microprocessor)|Cell's]] processing power, he adds a huge amount of ducks to the tub (all reacting as they would in real-life, due to the advanced physics engine). Phil comments dryly that "this is only possible with the use of [[Level of detail|LOD]] technology, for those of you that don't know, LOD stands for "Lots of Ducks"
== The EyeToy ==
Phil Harrison then invites the creator of [[EyeToy]] to show the new technology the PlayStation 3 can use. Plugging a standard PlayStation 2 EyeToy into the PlayStation 3, he picks up two ordinary cups and proceeds to move the cups in a scooping motion, which scoops up the water pictured on screen. (animated and reacting as real water would).
== Trivia ==
The ducks demo was the basis for ''[[Super Rub 'a' Dub]]'' which is a downloadable title for the PS3 produced by SCEE.
==External links== * [https://web.archive.org/web/20060307234500/http://media.ps3.ign.com/articles/615/615000/vids_1.html 2005 Ducks demo]
[[Category:PlayStation (brand)]] [[Category:Technology demonstrations]] [[Category:PlayStation 2]] [[Category:PlayStation 3]]
{{Sony-videogame-stub}} {{technology-stub}}

An '''electrochemical hydrogen compressor''' is a [[hydrogen compressor]] where hydrogen is supplied to the [[anode]], and [[compressed hydrogen]] is collected at the cathode<ref>[http://perso.ensem.inpl-nancy.fr/Olivier.Lottin/FDFC08/CD/Contributions/Grigoriev(res130).pdf Characterization of pem electrochemical hydrogen compressors]</ref> with an [[exergy efficiency]] up to and even beyond 80% for pressures up to 10,000 psi or 700 bars.<ref>[http://www.nrc-cnrc.gc.ca/eng/licensing/ifci/electrochemical-hydrogen-compressor.html Electrochemical hydrogen compressor] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100612195936/http://www.nrc-cnrc.gc.ca/eng/licensing/ifci/electrochemical-hydrogen-compressor.html |date=2010-06-12 }}</ref>
==Principle== [[File:Electrochemical Hydrogen Compressor Theory.svg|thumb|Diagram 1. Low pressure hydrogen separates into protons and electrons at the anode and the protons are electrochemically driven across the PEM to re-combine at the cathode - producing hydrogen under pressure. <ref>http://www.hydrogen.energy.gov/pdfs/review12/pd048_lipp_2012_o.pdf</ref>]]
A multi-stage electrochemical hydrogen compressor incorporates [[Membrane electrode assembly|membrane-electrode-assemblies]] (MEAs) separated by [[proton exchange membrane]]s (PEMs) in series to reach higher pressures, when a current is passed through the MEA protons and electrons are generated at the anode. The protons are electrochemically driven across the membrane to the cathode, after which they combine with the rerouted electrons to form hydrogen, which is fed to the hydrogen compressor to be oxidized at the anode of each cell to form [[proton]]s and [[electron]]s.
This type of compressor has no moving parts and is compact. With electrochemical compression of hydrogen a pressure of 14500 psi (1000 bar) is achieved, this world record was set by HyET from the Netherlands in 2011.<ref>[https://books.google.nl/books?id=qZ-mCwAAQBAJ&lpg=PP1&dq=Bouwman%2C%20P.%20in%20PEM%20Electrolysis%20for%20Hydrogen%20Production%2C%20Principles%20and%20Applications%20(eds.%20Bessarabov%2C%20D.%2C%20Wang%2C%20H.%2C%20Hui%2C%20L.%20%26%20Zhao%2C%20N.)%20Chapter%2013%2C%20(2015).&pg=PP1#v=onepage&q&f=false Bouwman, P. in ''PEM Electrolysis for Hydrogen Production, Principles and'']
[https://books.google.nl/books?id=qZ-mCwAAQBAJ&lpg=PP1&dq=Bouwman%2C%20P.%20in%20PEM%20Electrolysis%20for%20Hydrogen%20Production%2C%20Principles%20and%20Applications%20(eds.%20Bessarabov%2C%20D.%2C%20Wang%2C%20H.%2C%20Hui%2C%20L.%20%26%20Zhao%2C%20N.)%20Chapter%2013%2C%20(2015).&pg=PP1#v=onepage&q&f=false ''Applications'' (eds. Bessarabov, D., Wang, H., Hui, L. & Zhao, N.) Chapter 13,]
[https://books.google.nl/books?id=qZ-mCwAAQBAJ&lpg=PP1&dq=Bouwman%2C%20P.%20in%20PEM%20Electrolysis%20for%20Hydrogen%20Production%2C%20Principles%20and%20Applications%20(eds.%20Bessarabov%2C%20D.%2C%20Wang%2C%20H.%2C%20Hui%2C%20L.%20%26%20Zhao%2C%20N.)%20Chapter%2013%2C%20(2015).&pg=PP1#v=onepage&q&f=false (2015).]</ref> Water vapor [[partial pressure]], [[current density]], [[operating temperature]] and [[hydrogen]] back diffusion due to the [[pressure gradient]] have an effect on the maximum output pressure.
==Applications== [[Image:Electrochemical hydrogen compressor.jpg|left]] Electrochemical hydrogen compressors have been proposed for use in hydrogen refueling stations to pressurize hydrogen gas for storage. They have also been applied into novel refrigeration systems to pressurize hydrogen for absorption into [[metal hydrides]] or to pressurize other working fluids (such as [[refrigerants]])<ref>[http://www.xergyinc.com Xergy Inc.]</ref> as demonstrated by winners of the global GE's [[Ecomagination]] awards for 2011. These electrochemical compressors are noiseless, scalable, modular and highly efficient without the use of CFC's.
==See also== *[[Guided rotor compressor]] *[[Hydride compressor]] *[[Ionic liquid piston compressor]] *[[Gas diffusion electrode]] *[[Linear compressor]] *[[Timeline of hydrogen technologies]] *[[Concentration cell]]
==References==
<references/>
[[Category:Gas compressors]] [[Category:Hydrogen technologies]]

{{other uses|Field mill (disambiguation)}} [[Image:Pompeo Targone's field mill in Zonca's treatise of 1607.jpg|thumb|200px|Pompeo Targone's field mill, from Vittorio Zonca's treatise (1607)]] [[Image:Field mill in the Chinese Qiqi tushuo, 1627.jpg|thumb|200px|The field mill in the Chinese book ''[[Qiqi Tushuo]]'' (1627), by [[Johann Schreck]] and Wang Zheng]] A '''field mill''', also known as a '''camp mill''', was a premodern vehicle which acted as a mobile [[gristmill|mill]] used for grinding grains, which had the very practical use of feeding a moving army.<ref name="needham volume 4 part 2 255"/> ==History== ===Later Zhao=== In the ''Yezhongji'' (鄴中記) ('Record of Affairs at the [[Ye, China|Capital of the Later Zhao Dynasty]]') by Lu Hui, covering the history of the [[Later Zhao]] (319–351 AD) court in China, the text describes various mechanical devices used, including the wheeled [[odometer]] for measuring distance and the [[south-pointing chariot]] for indicating [[cardinal direction]].<ref name="needham volume 4 part 2 256">Needham, Volume 4, Part 2, 256.</ref> Two engineers in particular, the Palace Officer Xie Fei and Director of Imperial Workshops Wei Mengbian,<ref name="needham volume 4 part 2 257">Needham, Volume 4, Part 2, 257.</ref> were known for their designs and worked at the court of [[Shi Hu]] (r. 334–349).<ref name="needham volume 4 part 2 159"/> The two had crafted a four-wheeled carriage about 6 m (20 ft) long with water-spouting dragons hanging over a large golden [[Chinese Buddhism|Buddhist]] statue that had a mechanical wooden statue of a [[Taoism|Daoist]] continually rubbing his front.<ref name="needham volume 4 part 2 159">Needham, Volume 4, Part 2, 159.</ref> Other mechanical figures included ten Daoists dressed in monastic robes who continually rotated around the Buddha while periodically bowing, saluting, and throwing [[incense]] into a [[censer]].<ref name="needham volume 4 part 2 159"/> All of these mechanical figures were driven only by the movement of the carriage; once the carriage halted, the figures stopped moving and the water stopped spouting from the artificial dragons.<ref>Needham, Volume 4, Part 2, 160.</ref>
Xie and Wei created a similar device operated by wheel motion called the field mill, although it served a more practical purpose than the theatrical display of moving statues and water-spouting dragons.<ref>Needham, Volume 4, Part 2, 256–257.</ref> The ''Yezhongji'' states that the two devised a "pounding cart" or "pounding wagon" which had figurine statues armed with real [[Trip hammer|tilt hammers]] who pounded and [[Husk|hulled]] rice only when the cart moved.<ref name="needham volume 4 part 2 256"/> In addition to this they had a "mill cart" (field mill or camp mill) which had rotating [[millstone]]s mounted on their frames, which would rotate and grind wheat as the cart moved forward.<ref name="needham volume 4 part 2 256"/> Just like the carriage with mechanical figures mentioned above, when the carriage stopped, the devices associated with them halted.<ref name="needham volume 4 part 2 257"/>
===Europe===
Use of the field mill in China seems to have died out in use after the Later Zhao, since it was no longer mentioned in Chinese texts until [[Ming Dynasty]].<ref>Needham, Volume 4, Part 2, 255 & 257.</ref>
The [[Italy|Italian]] military engineer [[Pompeo Targone]], who was most notably involved in the [[Siege of La Rochelle|Siege of La Rochelle (1627-1628)]] in western [[France]], invented the field mill in Europe by 1580.<ref name="needham volume 4 part 2 255">Needham, Volume 4, Part 2, 255.</ref> As shown in the Italian [[Vittorio Zonca]]'s engineering treatise of 1607, two mills mounted to a wagon are rotated by a horse whim and gearing while in a stationary position at military camp or near billets.<ref name="needham volume 4 part 2 255"/>
In the ''[[Yuanxi Qiqi Tushuo Luzui]]'' ('Collected Diagrams and Explanations of the Wonderful Machines of the Far West') compiled and translated in 1627 by [[Germany|German]] [[Jesuit]] [[Johann Schreck]] (1576–1630) and Ming Dynasty Chinese author Wang Zheng (王徵 1571–1644), a field mill is shown amongst other devices.<ref name="needham volume 4 part 2 255"/> In this picture, two mills are operated by the gearing of a rotating bar and a whippletree harnessed to a single horse, unlike the two horses seen in Zonca's illustration.<ref name="needham volume 4 part 2 255 256">Needham, Volume 4, Part 2, 255–256.</ref>
==See also==
*[[List of Chinese inventions]]
==Notes== {{reflist}} ==References== *Needham, Joseph. (1986). ''Science and Civilization in China: Volume 4, Part 2, Mechanical Engineering''. Taipei: Caves Books Ltd. ==External links== *[http://www.mpiwg-berlin.mpg.de/CHINA/intro_qq_ts.html An introduction to the Qi Qi Tu Shuo]
[[Category:Chinese inventions]] [[Category:Grinding mills]] [[Category:Italian inventions]] [[Category:Later Zhao]] [[Category:Military history of China]] [[Category:Military history of Italy]] [[Category:Military technology]] [[Category:Military vehicles of China]]

{{Infobox journal | title = Frontiers of Architectural Research | publisher = [[Elsevier]] on behalf of [[Higher Education Press]] | editor = Jianguo Wang | discipline = [[Architecture]] | cover = | abbreviation = Front. Archit. Res. | country = | openaccess = | ISSN = 2095-2635 | eISSN = 2095-2643 | frequency = Quarterly | history = 2012–present | website = http://www.elsevier.com/locate/issn/20952635 | link1 = http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/journal/20952635 | link1-name = Oonline archive }} '''''Frontiers of Architectural Research''''' is a quarterly [[peer-reviewed]] [[open access]] [[academic journal]] covering the field of [[architecture]], including architectural design and theory, architectural science and technology, [[urban planning]], [[landscape architecture]], existing building renovation and architectural heritage conservation. It is published by [[Elsevier]] on behalf of [[Higher Education Press]]. The journal was established in 2012 and the [[editor-in-chief]] is Jianguo Wang ([[Southeast University (China)]]).
The journal is abstracted and indexed in the [[Chinese Science Citation Database]], [[Scopus]], and the [[Emerging Sources Citation Index]].
== External links == *{{Official website|http://www.journals.elsevier.com/frontiers-of-architectural-research}}
[[Category:Architecture journals]] [[Category:English-language journals]] [[Category:Quarterly journals]] [[Category:Publications established in 2012]] [[Category:Building research]]

revision.text: {{Userspace draft|source=ArticleWizard|date=October 2016}} [[File:Acer E360 Socket 939 motherboard by Foxconn.svg|thumb|A classic motherboard with on-board integrated graphics processors, a discrete graphics card can be installed at a PCI slot|alt=Acer E360 Socket 939 motherboard by Foxconn]] '''GPU switching''' is a mechanism used on computers with multiple graphic controllers. This mechanism allows the user to either maximize the graphic performance or prolong battery life by switching between the graphic cards. It's mostly used on gaming laptops which usually have an [[Graphics processing unit#Integrated graphics|integrated graphic device]] and a [[Graphics processing unit#Dedicated graphics cards|discrete video card]]. == Basic components == Most computers using this feature contain integrated graphics processors and dedicated graphics cards that applies to the following categories. === Integrated graphics === Also known as: ''Integrated graphics'', ''shared graphics solutions'', ''integrated graphics processors'' (IGP) or ''unified memory architecture'' (UMA). This kind of graphics processors usually have much fewer processing units and share the same memory with the [[Central processing unit|CPU]].[[File:Intel core i5-2500 top IMGP9336 wp.jpg|thumb|Intel Core i5 processor with integrated HD Graphics 2000|175x175px]] Sometimes the graphics processors are integrated onto a motherboard. It is commonly known as: ''on-board graphics.''{{Cite web|url=https://www.quora.com/What-is-the-difference-between-dedicated-graphics-and-shared-graphics|title=What is the difference between dedicated graphics and shared graphics? - Quora|website=www.quora.com|access-date=2016-10-24}} A motherboard with on-board graphics processors doesn't require a discrete graphics card or a [[Central processing unit|CPU]] with graphics processors to operate. === Dedicated graphics cards === Also known as: ''discrete graphics cards''. Unlike integrated graphics, dedicated graphics cards have much more processing units and have its own [[Random-access memory|RAM]] with much higher memory bandwidth. In some cases, a dedicated graphics chip can be integrated onto the [[motherboard]]s, B150-GP104 for example. Regardless of the fact that the graphics chip is integrated, it is still counted as a dedicated graphics cards system because the graphics chip is integrated with its own memory. == Theory == [[File:Motherboard diagram.svg|thumb|Motherboard diagram|392x392px]] === Northbridge control === Most computers have a motherboard that uses a [[Southbridge (computing)|Southbridge]] and [[Northbridge (computing)|Northbridge]] structure. The [[Northbridge (computing)|Northbridge]] is one of the core logic [[chipset]] that handles communications among the [[Central processing unit|CPU]], [[Graphics processing unit|GPU]], [[Random-access memory|RAM]] and the Southbridge. The discrete graphics card is usually installed onto the graphics card slot and the integrated graphics is integrated onto the CPU or occasionally onto the Northbridge. The Northbridge is the most responsible for switching between GPUs. The way how it works usually has the following process:{{Cite news|url=http://www.computerhope.com/jargon/n/northbri.htm|title=What is northbridge?|access-date=2016-11-06}}{{Cite news|url=http://www.computerhope.com/jargon/n/northbri.htm|title=What is northbridge?|access-date=2016-11-06}}{{Cite news|url=http://computer.howstuffworks.com/motherboard.htm|title=How Motherboards Work|date=2005-07-20|newspaper=HowStuffWorks|access-date=2016-11-06}} # The Northbridge receives input from Southbridge through the [[Bus (computing)#Internal buses|internal bus]]. # The Northbridge passes down the input to CPU through the Front-side bus. # The CPU runs the task assignment application (usually the graphics card driver) to determine which GPU core to use. # The CPU passes down the command to the Northbridge. # The Northbridge passes down the command to the according GPU core. # The GPU core processes the command and returns the rendered data back to the Northbridge. # The Northbridge sends the rendered data back to Southbridge. === Southbridge control === The Southbridge is also named as [[I/O Controller Hub]] (ICH). It handles all of a computer's I/O functions, such as receiving the keyboard input and outputting the data onto the screen. The way how it usually works usually has two steps:{{Cite news|url=http://www.computerhope.com/jargon/s/soutbrid.htm|title=What is southbridge?|access-date=2016-11-06}} # Take in the user input and pass it down to the Northbridge. # (Optional) Receive the rendered data from the Northbridge and output it. The reason why the second step can be optional is that sometimes the rendered the data is outputted directly from the discrete graphics card which is located on the graphics card slot so there is no need to output the data through the Southbridge. == Main purpose == GPU switching is mostly used for saving energy by switching between graphic cards. The dedicated graphics cards consume much more power than integrated graphics but also provides higher 3D performances, which is needed for a better gaming and CAD experience. Following is a list of the [[Thermal design power|TDPs]] of the most popular CPU with integrated graphics and dedicated graphics cards. {| class="wikitable sortable" |+[[Thermal design power|TDP]] of Integrated Graphics and Dedicated Graphics Cards{{Cite news|url=http://ark.intel.com/|title=ARK {{!}} Your Source for Intel® Product Specifications|newspaper=Intel® ARK (Product Specs)|access-date=2016-10-24}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.geforce.com/|title=What's New {{!}} GeForce|website=www.geforce.com|access-date=2016-10-24}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.notebookcheck.net/|title=Notebook / Laptop Reviews and News|website=www.notebookcheck.net|access-date=2016-10-24}}{{Cite web|url=https://www.amd.com/en-us|title=Graphics, Processors and Immersive VR Solutions {{!}} AMD|website=www.amd.com|access-date=2016-10-24}} ! colspan="7" |Model ! rowspan="4" |Platform |- ! colspan="3" |Integrated Graphics ! colspan="4" |Dedicated Graphics Cards |- ! colspan="2" |[[Intel]] ! rowspan="2" |TDP ! rowspan="2" |[[Nvidia]] ! rowspan="2" |TDP ! rowspan="2" |[[Advanced Micro Devices|AMD]] ! rowspan="2" |TDP |- !CPU Model & Frequency !Intel IGP Serie |- |Intel Core i7-6700K @ 4.00 GHz |Intel HD Graphics 530 |91W |GTX 1080 |180W |Radeon R9 Fury |275W | rowspan="3" |Desktop |- |Intel Core i5-6600K @ 3.50 GHz |Intel HD Graphics 530 |91W |GTX 970 |145W |Radeon R9 Nano |175W |- |Intel Core i7-4790K @ 4.40 GHz |Intel HD Graphics 4600 |88W |GTX 780Ti |250W |Radeon RX 480 |150W |- |Intel Core i7-6700HQ @ 2.60 GHz |Intel HD Graphics 530 |45W |GTX 1080 |165W |Radeon R9 M485X |125W | rowspan="4" |Laptop |- |Intel Core i7-6500U @ 2.50 GHz |Intel HD Graphics 520 |15W |GTX 980M |100W |Radeon R9 M470X |75W |- |Intel Core i5-6200U @ 2.30 GHz |Intel HD Graphics 520 |15W |GTX 880M |103W |Radeon R9 M470 |75W |- |Intel Core i5-5200U @ 2.20 GHz |Intel HD Graphics 5500 |15W |GTX 870M |103W |Radeon HD 7950M |50W |} The dedicated graphics cards exhibit much higher power consumption than the integrated graphics on both platforms. Disabling them when no heavy graphics processing is needed can significantly lower the power consumption. == Technologies == {{Main article|Nvidia Optimus|AMD Hybrid Graphics}} [[File:Rendering Process.png|thumb|A classic graphic rendering process with multiple GPU cores]] === Nvidia Optimus === Nvidia Optimus™ is a computer GPU switching technology created by [[Nvidia]] that can dynamically and seamlessly switch between two graphic cards based on running programs. === AMD Enduro === AMD Enduro™ is a collective brand developed by AMD that features many new technologies that can significantly save power. It was previously named as: ''PowerXpress'' and ''Dynamic Switchable Graphics (DSG).'' This technology implements a sophisticated system to predict the potential usage need for graphics cards and switch between graphics cards based on predicted need. This technology also introduces a new power control plan that allows the discrete graphics cards consume no energy when idling.{{Cite web|url=https://www.amd.com/en-us/innovations/software-technologies/processors-for-business/enduro|title=Enduro™ Power Management Technologies {{!}} AMD|website=www.amd.com|access-date=2016-11-06}} == Manufacturers == === Integrated graphics === In personal computers, the [[Graphics processing unit#Integrated graphics|IGP (integrated graphics processors)]] are mostly manufactured by [[Intel]] and [[Advanced Micro Devices|AMD]] and are integrated onto their [[Central processing unit|CPUs]]. They are commonly known as:{{Cite news|url=http://www.tomshardware.com/picturestory/710-history-of-intel-cpus.html|title=The History Of Intel CPUs|date=2016-06-11|newspaper=Tom's Hardware|access-date=2016-10-24}}{{Cite news|url=http://www.tomshardware.com/picturestory/713-amd-cpu-history.html|title=The History Of AMD CPUs|date=2016-04-25|newspaper=Tom's Hardware|access-date=2016-10-24}} * [[Intel HD and Iris Graphics]] - also called ''HD series'' and ''Iris series'' * [[AMD Accelerated Processing Unit]] (APU) - also formerly known as: ''fusion'' === Dedicated graphics cards === The most popular dedicated graphics cards are manufactured by [[Advanced Micro Devices|AMD]] and [[Nvidia]]. They are commonly known as: * [[Radeon|AMD Radeon]] * [[GeForce|Nvidia GeForce]] == Drivers & OS Support == Most common [[operating system]]s have built-in support for this feature. However, the users may download the updated drivers from [http://www.nvidia.com/Download/index.aspx?lang=en-us Nvidia] or [http://support.amd.com/en-us/download AMD] for better experience. === Windows support === [[Windows 7]] has built-in support for this feature. The system automatically switches between GPUs depending on the program that's running. However, the user may switch the GPUs manually through device manager or power manager.{{Cite web|url=https://www.energystar.gov/products/low_carbon_it_campaign/power_management_computer/windows_7|title=Manually activating power management in Windows 7|website=www.energystar.gov|access-date=2016-10-24}} === Linux support === In the Linux systems, a patch named vga_switcheroo{{Cite web|url=https://help.ubuntu.com/community/HybridGraphics|title=HybridGraphics - Community Help Wiki|website=help.ubuntu.com|access-date=2016-10-24}} has been added to the [[Linux kernel]] since version 2.6.34 in order to deal with multiple [[Graphics processing unit|GPU]]. Here, the switch requires a restart of the [[X Window System]] to be taken into account. [http://sites.google.com/site/ubuntucontrolcenter/ Ubuntu Control Center] allows the user to access vga_switcheroo functionality through a [[Graphical user interface|GUI]]. === Mac OS support === Mac OS has built-in support for this feature since v10.5 Leopard. Since [[OS X Mountain Lion]], [[Apple Inc.|Apple]] has integrated the GPU monitor into the Activity Monitor.{{Cite news|url=https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT202053|title=MacBook Pro: How to determine which graphics processor is in use|newspaper=Apple Support|language=en-US|access-date=2016-10-24}} == Existing troubles == * System incompatibility or unstable power supply may cause [[Blue Screen of Death]] or other bugs * Unable to switch if the system wrongly estimated the required computing resource * Switching may cause unstable voltage which can lead to flashy screen * Inconsistent drivers across vendors for smooth switching == See also == * [[Graphics processing unit|Graphics processing unit (GPU)]] * [[Nvidia Optimus]] * [[ATI Hybrid Graphics]] == References == {{Reflist}} == External links == * [https://www.amd.com/en-us/markets/game/technologies AMD official website] * [http://www.nvidia.com/page/technologies.html Nvidia official website] * [http://blogs.intel.com/technology/ Intel official website] * [http://www.notebookcheck.net/ Notebook Check official website] {{Graphics Processing Unit}} [[Category:Articles created via the Article Wizard]] [[Category:Computer hardware]]

{{distinguish|Gunpowder Plot}} {{Infobox military conflict | image = PowderMagazineinWilliamsburg.jpg | image_size = 300 | caption = The powder magazine in Williamsburg from which the gunpowder was removed | conflict = Gunpowder Incident | partof = the [[American Revolutionary War]] | date = April 20, 1775 | place = [[Williamsburg, Virginia]] | coordinates = {{coord|37|16|14.66|N|76|41|59.98|W|type:event_region:US-VA_dim:20|display=title}} | result = British sailors remove military supplies
Militia uprising peacefully resolved | campaignbox = {{Campaignbox American Revolutionary War: Southern 1775-1779}} }} The '''Gunpowder Incident''' (or '''Gunpowder Affair''') was a conflict early in the [[American Revolutionary War]] between [[John Murray, 4th Earl of Dunmore|Lord Dunmore]], the Royal Governor of the [[Colony of Virginia]], and [[militia]] led by [[Patrick Henry]]. On April 20, 1775, one day after the [[Battles of Lexington and Concord]] (and well before news of that event reached Virginia), Lord Dunmore ordered the removal of the [[gunpowder]] from the [[gunpowder magazine|magazine]] in [[Williamsburg, Virginia]] to a [[Royal Navy]] ship. This action sparked local unrest, and militia companies began mustering throughout the colony. [[Patrick Henry]] led a small militia force toward Williamsburg to force return of the gunpowder to the colony's control. The matter was resolved without conflict when a payment of [[Pound sterling|£]]330 was made to Henry. Dunmore, fearing for his personal safety, later retreated to a naval vessel, ending royal control of the colony. ==Background== Military tensions began to rise in the [[Thirteen Colonies|British colonies of North America]] in 1774 when a series of legislative acts by the British Parliament known as the [[Intolerable Acts]] began to be implemented in the colonies. The colonies, in solidarity with the [[Province of Massachusetts Bay]], which had been singled out for punishment by those acts in the wake of the [[Boston Tea Party]], had organized a Congress to meet in September 1774.Russell, pp. 45–46 During the meeting of the [[First Continental Congress]] word arrived of a militia uprising in Massachusetts that became known as the [[Powder Alarm]]. In early September, General [[Thomas Gage]], the royal governor of Massachusetts, had removed gunpowder from a powder magazine in [[Charlestown, Massachusetts|Charlestown]] (in a location now in [[Somerville, Massachusetts|Somerville]]), and militia from all over [[New England]] had flocked to the area in response to false rumors that violence had been involved.Richmond, p. 6Russell, p. 48 One consequence of this action was that the Congress called for the colonies to organize militia companies for their defense. Another was that [[William Legge, 2nd Earl of Dartmouth|Lord Dartmouth]], the [[Secretary of State for the Colonies]], advised the colonial governors to secure their military supplies, and prohibited importation of further supplies of powder. In early 1775, Virginians began to organize militia companies and seek out military supplies (weapons, ammunition, and gunpowder) to arm and equip them. [[John Murray, 4th Earl of Dunmore|Lord Dunmore]], [[Colony of Virginia|Virginia]]'s royal governor, saw this rising unrest in his colony and sought to deprive Virginia militia of these supplies.Selby and Higginbotham, p. 1 It was not until after [[Patrick Henry]]'s "[[Give me liberty or give me death]]" speech at the [[Second Virginia Convention]] on March 23 that Dunmore "[thought] it prudent to remove some Gunpowder which was in a Magazine in this place."Williamson, p. 54 Although British Army troops had been withdrawn from Virginia in the wake of the Powder Alarm, there were several Royal Navy ships in the Virginia waters of [[Chesapeake Bay]]. On April 19, Lord Dunmore quietly brought a company of British sailors into [[Williamsburg, Virginia|Williamsburg]] and quartered them in the governor's mansion. Dunmore then ordered Captain [[Henry Collins (Royal Navy officer)|Henry Collins]], commander of [[HMS Magdalen|HMS ''Magdalen'']], to remove the gunpowder from the magazine in Williamsburg. ==Removing the gunpowder== [[File:Williamsburg magazine drawing exterior.gif|thumb|right|Drawing of the octagonal Williamsburg Magazine]] On the night of April 20, Royal Navy sailors went to the Williamsburg powder magazine, loaded fifteen half barrels of powder into the governor's wagon, and transported it to the eastern end of the [[Quarterpath Road]] to be loaded aboard the ''Magdalen'' in the [[James River (Virginia)|James River]]. The act was discovered by townsfolk while underway, and they sounded an alarm. Local militia rallied to the scene, and riders spread word of the incident across the colony. Dunmore had as a precaution armed his servants with muskets, and it was only the calming words of Patriot leaders, including the Speaker of the [[Virginia House of Burgesses|House of Burgesses]], [[Peyton Randolph]], that prevented the assembling crowd from storming Dunmore's mansion.Russell, p. 52 The city council demanded the return of the powder, claiming it was the property of the colony and not [[the Crown]]. Dunmore demurred, stating that he was moving the powder as protection against its seizure during a rumored slave uprising, and would eventually return it. This seemed to satisfy the assembled crowd, and it dispersed peacefully.Selby and Higginbotham, p. 2 Unrest however persisted in Williamsburg and spread throughout the countryside. After a second crowd was convinced to disperse by Patriot leaders, Dunmore reacted angrily, warning on April 22 that if attacked, he would "declare Freedom to the Slaves, and reduce the City of Williamsburg to Ashes." He also told a Williamsburg [[alderman]] that he had "once fought for the Virginians" but "By God, I would let them see that I could fight against them."Selby and Higginbotham, p. 3 [[File:Patrick henry.JPG|thumb|left|upright=0.5|[[Patrick Henry]], portrait by George Bagby Matthews c. 1891 after an original by [[Thomas Sully]]]] By April 29, militia mobilizing in the countryside had learned of the battles at Lexington and Concord. Nearly 700 men mustered at [[Fredericksburg, Virginia|Fredericksburg]], and decided to send a messenger to Williamsburg to assess the situation before marching on the capital. Peyton Randolph advised against violence, and [[George Washington]], a longtime leader of the Virginia militia, concurred. In response to their advice, the Fredericksburg militia voted by a narrow margin not to march.Russell, p. 53 However, militia from other parts of the colony did march to Williamsburg. The [[Hanover County, Virginia|Hanover County]] militia, led by Patrick Henry, voted on May 2 to march on Williamsburg. Henry dispatched a small company to the home of Richard Corbin, who was the Deputy Collector of the Royal Revenue in Virginia, in a bid to force him to pay for the powder from Crown revenue in his possession; the remainder of the Hanover County militia, numbering about 150, marched toward Williamsburg, arriving about {{convert|15|mi|km}} away on May 3. That day Dunmore's family escaped Williamsburg to [[Porto Bello (Williamsburg, Virginia)|Porto Bello]], Lord Dunmore's hunting lodge on the [[York River (Virginia)|York River]], and from there to {{HMS|Fowey|1749|6}}, lying at anchor in the York River.{{cite journal |title=Numerous Errors in Wilstach's 'Tidewater Virginia' Challenge Criticism |last= Kibler |first=J. Luther |journal=[[William and Mary Quarterly]] | series = 2nd Ser. |volume=11 |issue=2 |date=April 1931 |pages=152–156 |doi=10.2307/1921010 |publisher=Omohundro Institute of Early American History and Culture |jstor=1921010 }} Corbin was not at home—he was in Williamsburg, meeting with Dunmore.Selby and Higginbotham, p. 4 Henry was advised by [[Carter Braxton]], Corbin's son-in-law and a Patriot member of the House of Burgesses, not to enter the city, while Braxton rode into the city and negotiated a payment. The next day, May 4, Henry received a [[bill of exchange]] for £330 signed by a wealthy plantation owner, as payment for the powder (he refused the offer of payment from Crown accounts). Henry then departed to take his place as a member of Virginia's delegation to the [[Second Continental Congress]], promising to deliver the money to "the Virginia Delegates at the General congress".Vaughan, p. 88 On May 6 Dunmore issued a proclamation charging Henry with extortion of the £330, and forbidding the citizenry to assist Henry in any way. Henry was offered protection by several counties, and was escorted by several companies of militia to the Maryland border as he made his way to [[Philadelphia]].Selby and Higginbotham, p. 5 ==Aftermath== [[File:Sir Joshua Reynolds - John Murray, 4th Earl of Dunmore - Google Art Project.jpg|thumb|right|upright=0.5|Portrait of Dunmore by Sir [[Joshua Reynolds]], 1765]] The incident burnished Henry's reputation while worsening Dunmore's popularity.Vaughan, p. 89 Although his family briefly returned to Williamsburg on May 12 as a sign of good faith, relations between Dunmore and the House of Burgesses continued to deteriorate. On June 8, Dunmore and his family fled the [[Governor's Palace (Williamsburg, Virginia)|Governor's Palace]] in the middle of the night and took up residence aboard ''Fowey''.Selby and Higginbotham, pp. 41–43 The Burgesses had been deliberating the [[Conciliatory Resolution]], a proposal that was an attempt by the [[North Ministry]] to divide the colonies. In the wake of Dunmore's flight, the Burgesses rejected the proposal.Selby and Higginbotham, p. 44 Dunmore continued to make vigorous attempts to regain control of the colony, but after a decisive defeat of British forces [[Battle of Great Bridge|at Great Bridge]] in December, he was reduced to raiding operations and eventually abandoned the colony for good in August 1776.Russell, pp. 68–76 Virginia's government was first taken over by a [[Committee of Safety (American Revolution)|Committee of Safety]], chosen by the [[Third Virginia Convention]] in July 1775; Patrick Henry became the independent state's first [[Governor of Virginia|governor]] in July 1776.Selby and Higginbotham, pp. 52,121 ==See also== * [[Powder Alarm]], a similar episode in Massachusetts ==Notes== {{reflist|colwidth=24em}} ==References== *{{cite book|title=Powder Alarm 1774|first=Robert P|last=Richmond|publisher=Auerbach|year=1971|ref=Richmond|isbn=978-0-87769-073-3|location=Princeton, NJ|oclc=162197}} *{{cite book| url=https://books.google.com/books?id=5DFy0eWaPxIC&pg=PA72&lpg=PA72| title=The American Revolution in the Southern colonies | first=David Lee|last= Russell| publisher=McFarland| year=2000| isbn=978-0-7864-0783-5 |location=Jefferson, NC| oclc=248087936}} *{{cite book|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=WfCBYZs_jIMC&pg=PA62|title=The Revolution in Virginia, 1775–1783|first=John E|last=Selby|author2=Higginbotham, Don|publisher=Colonial Williamsburg|year=2007|isbn=978-0-87935-233-2|ref=Selby|oclc=124076712|location=Williamsburg, VA}} *{{cite book|last=Vaughan|first=David|title=Give Me Liberty: the Uncompromising Statesmanship of Patrick Henry|publisher=Cumberland House Publishing|year=1997|location=Nashville, TN|isbn=978-1-888952-22-3|oclc=36372369}} ==External links== *[http://www.revwar75.com/battles/primarydocs/williamsburg.htm "Primary Documents Relating to the Seizure of Powder at Williamsburg, VA, April 21, 1775"] *[http://research.history.org/pf/viewer.cfm?image=newspapers/lg_gunpowderart1.jpg|newspapers/lg_gunpowderart2.jpg&imageTitle=Virginia%20Gazette&imageSubTitle=The%20Gunpowder%20Incident Old Virginia Gazette article on the Gunpowder Incident] *[http://earlyamerica.com/review/2004_summer_fall/proclamation.htm Proclamation against Patrick Henry] *[https://web.archive.org/web/20051203055908/http://colonialwilliamsburg.com/Almanack/places/hb/hbmag.cfm Colonial Williamsburg – Magazine (including the Gunpowder Incident)] {{Virginia during the American Revolutionary War}} {{Good article}} [[Category:1775 in the Thirteen Colonies]] [[Category:American Revolution]] [[Category:American Revolutionary War]] [[Category:Virginia in the American Revolution]] [[Category:Williamsburg, Virginia]] [[Category:1775 in Virginia]] [[Category:Patrick Henry]] [[Category:Gunpowder]] [[Category:Controversies in the United States]] [[Category:Gun politics in the United States]]

[[File:UK Hazchem Plate - 1203 Petrol.svg|thumb|right|300px|A sample Hazchem plate for petrol.]] [[File:Tinknells_WX59FXW.jpg|thumb|right|250px|A tanker carrying [[Kerosene]] with a Hazchem plate affixed to the side of the tank.]] '''Hazchem''' (hazardous chemicals)({{IPAc-en|'|h|æ|z|k|ɛ|m}}){{Cite OED|Hazchem}} is a warning plate system used in [[Australia]], [[Malaysia]], [[New Zealand]], [[India]] and the [[United Kingdom]] for vehicles transporting [[dangerous goods|hazardous substances]], and on storage facilities. The top-left section of the plate gives the Emergency Action Code (EAC) telling the [[fire brigade]] what actions to take if there's an accident or fire. The middle-left section containing a 4 digit number gives the [[UN number|UN Substance Identification Number]] describing the material. The lower-left section gives the telephone number that should be called if special advice is needed. The warning symbol in the top right indicates the general hazard class of the material. The bottom-right of the plate carries a company [[logo]] or name. There is also a standard null Hazchem plate to indicate the transport of non-hazardous substances. The null plate does not include an EAC or substance identification. The [[National Chemical Emergency Centre]] (NCEC) in the United Kingdom provides a Free Online Hazchem Guide.{{Cite web |url=http://www.the-ncec.com/free-online-hazmat-hazchem-guide |title=Free Online Hazchem Guide |access-date=2013-08-20 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140512065348/http://the-ncec.com/free-online-hazmat-hazchem-guide |archive-date=2014-05-12 |dead-url=yes |df= }} == Emergency Action Code == The Emergency Action Code (EAC) is a three character code displayed on all dangerous goods classed carriers, and provides a quick assessment to first responders and emergency responders (i.e. [[fire fighter]]s and [[police]]) of what actions to take should the carrier carrying such goods become involved in an incident (traffic collision, for example). EAC's are characterised by a single number (1 to 4) and either one or two letters (depending on the hazard). NCEC was commissioned by the Department for Communities and Local Government (CLG) to edit the EAC List 2013 publication, outlining the application of Hazchem Emergency Actions Codes (EACs) in Britain for 2013. The Dangerous Goods Emergency Action Code (EAC) List is reviewed every two years and is an essential compliance document for all emergency services, local government and for those who may control the planning for, and prevention of, emergencies involving dangerous goods. The current EAC List is 20013. NCEC has been at the heart of the UK EAC system since its inception in the early 1970s, publishing the list on behalf of the UK Government until 1996 and resuming its management in 2008. The printed version of the book can be purchased from TSO directly ({{ISBN|9780117541184}}) or downloaded as a [https://d18hkfaesybon0.cloudfront.net/ncec/media/assets/downloads/ncec-emergency-action-code-list-2017.pdf PDF file] from NCEC’s website. === HazChem fire suppression === {| class="wikitable" "border="1" float="right" |Number |Action |- | '''1''' | coarse spray |- | '''2''' | fog1 |- | '''3''' | foam |- | '''4''' | dry agent2 |} 1 In the absence of fog equipment, a fine spray may be used.NSW Rural Fire Service Firefighters' Pocket Book pg. 18
2 Water must not be allowed to come into contact with the substance at risk. This number is indicative of what type of [[fire suppressant]] should be used to suppress a fire from igniting or extinguish a fire caused by the chemical. The system is designed to rank fire suppression methods in order of usability. For example, a chemical marked with the number '''2''' or '''Fog''' can be attacked with methods '''3''' (Foam) or '''4''' (Dry Agent) but not with '''1''' (Jets).SafeWork SA (2000) ''Safeguards''. Retrieved 2010-10-03 from http://www.safework.sa.gov.au/uploaded_files/ds9i.pdf. (page 1: ''The system permits a medium of a higher numeric classification to be used than that indicated, however, a medium with a lower numeric classification than that indicated should not be used.'') The "Dry Agent" method must be used for chemicals that have an undesirable reaction with water and must not be allowed to come in contact with water, therefore '''4''' is the highest ranking suppression method as all of the other methods use water. === HazChem safety parameters === Each EAC contains at least one letter, which determines which category the chemical falls under, and which also highlights the violence of the chemical (i.e. likelihood to spontaneously combust, explode etc.), what [[personal protective equipment]] to use while working around the chemical and what action to take when disposing of the chemical. [[File:Nswrfsfpbhazchem.jpg|500px|right|HazChem information within the NSW Rural Fire Service Firefighters' Pocket Book.]] {| class="wikitable" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="1" ! Category ! Violence ! Protection ! Substance control |- | align="center" | '''P''' | align="center" | '''V''' | align="center" rowspan="2" | Full | align="center" rowspan="6" | Dilute |- | align="center" |'''R''' | |- | align="center" |'''S''' | align="center" rowspan="2" | '''V''' | align="center" |BA |- | align="center" style="background: #000000; color: #FFFFFF;" |'''S''' | align="center" |BA for fire only |- | align="center" |'''T''' | align="center" rowspan="2" | | align="center" |BA |- | align="center" style="background: #000000; color: #FFFFFF;" |'''T''' | align="center" |BA for fire only |- | align="center" |'''W''' | align="center" |'''V''' | align="center" rowspan="2" | Full | align="center" rowspan="6" | Contain |- | align="center" |'''X''' | |- | align="center" |'''Y''' | align="center" rowspan="2" | '''V''' | align="center" |BA |- | align="center" style="background: #000000; color: #FFFFFF;" |'''Y''' | align="center" |BA for fire only |- | align="center" |'''Z''' | align="center" rowspan="2" | | align="center" |BA |- | align="center" style="background: #000000; color: #FFFFFF;" |'''Z''' | align="center" |BA for fire only |- | align="center" style="border-top: solid medium;" |'''E''' || align="left" style="border-top: solid medium;" colspan="3"|Consider evacuation |} [[File:Hazchem3yediff.jpg|thumb|right|Comparison denoting the difference between [[Personal Protective Equipment|PPE]] deployment with 3YE chemicals]] Each category is assigned a letter to determine what actions are required when handling, containing and disposing of the chemical in question. Eight 'major categories' exist which are commonly denoted by a black letter on a white background. Four subcategories exist which specifically deal with what type of personal protective equipment responders must wear when handling the emergency, denoted by a white letter on a black background. In Australia with the update of the [[Australian Dangerous Goods Code]] volume 7 as of 2010, the white letter on a black background has been removed, making BA a requirement at all large incidents regardless of whether the substance is involved in a fire. If a category is classed as violent, this means that the chemical can be violently or explosively reactive, either with the atmosphere or water, or both (which could be marked by the [[HAZMAT Class 4 Flammable Solids|Dangerous when Wet]] symbol). Protection is divided up into three categories of personal protective equipment, ''Full'', ''BA'' and ''BA for fire only''. Full denotes that full personal protective equipment provisions must be used around and in contact with the chemical, which will usually include a portable [[Self-contained breathing apparatus|breathing apparatus]] and water tight and chemical proof suit. ''BA'' (acronym for breathing apparatus) specifies that a portable breathing apparatus must be used at all times in and around the chemical, and ''BA for fire only'' specifies that a breathing apparatus is not necessary for short exposure periods to the chemical but is required if the chemical is on alight. ''BA for fire only'' is denoted within the emergency action code as a white letter on a black background, while a black letter on a white background denotes breathing apparatus at all times. When changing the background colour is not possible (such as with handwriting), the use of brackets means the same as a black background. "3[Y]E" means the same as a white letter on a black background. Substance control specifies what to do with the chemical in the event of a spill, either ''dilute'' or ''contain''. Dilute means that the chemical may be washed down the drain with large quantities of water. ''Contain'' requires that the spillage must not come in contact with drains or water courses. In the event of a chemical incident, the EAC may specify that an evacuation may be necessary as the chemical poses a public hazard which may extend beyond the immediate vicinity. If evacuation is not possible, advice to stay in doors and secure all points of ventilation may be necessary. This condition is denoted by an '''E''' at the end of any emergency action code. It is an optional letter, depending on the nature of the chemical. === Examples === {| class="wikitable" border="1" |'''3'''||align="center"|'''Y'''||'''E'''||Use foam or dry agent, substance reacts violently/is explosive, BA use is essential, evacuate vicinity, contain spill. |- |'''3''' ||align="center" style="background: #000000; color: #FFFFFF;"|'''Y'''||'''E'''||Use foam or dry agent, substance reacts violently/is explosive, Use BA if fire present, evacuate vicinity, contain spill. |- |'''2'''||colspan="2"|'''R'''||Use fog, foam or dry agent, substance is not violent, use full [[Personal Protective Equipment|PPE]], dilute spill. |- |'''4'''||colspan="2"|'''X'''||Use dry agent only, substance is not violent, full [[Personal Protective Equipment|PPE]] essential, contain spill. |- |'''1'''||align="center" style="background: #000000; color: #FFFFFF;"|'''S'''||'''E'''||Use jets, fog, foam or dry agent; BA for fire only; evacuate vicinity; dilute spill. |} A very commonly displayed example is '''3YE''' on [[petrol]] [[tank truck|tankers]]. This means that a fire must be fought using foam or dry agent (if a small fire), that it can react violently and is explosive, that fire fighters must wear a portable breathing apparatus at all times, or if a white on black Y, only if there is a fire, and that the run-off needs to be contained. It also indicates to the [[Incident Command System|incident controller]] that evacuation of the surrounding area may be necessary. === Calculation of Hazchem action code for multi-loads or sites with multiple Hazchem codes === Example:Australian Dangerous Goods Code, 7th Edition, Section C2.7{{Cite web |url=http://jr.chemwatch.net/help/goldffx/Repository/GoldFFX%20Help.html?HazchemCodeCalculationforMoreSub.html |title=Archived copy |access-date=2015-01-20 |archive-url=https://archive.is/20150120091347/http://jr.chemwatch.net/help/goldffx/Repository/GoldFFX%20Help.html?HazchemCodeCalculationforMoreSub.html |archive-date=2015-01-20 |dead-url=yes |df= }} There are three substances to be carried as a multi-load, having emergency action codes of 3Y, •2S and 4WE. '''1st Character (Number):''' The first character of the EAC for each of the three substances is 3, 2 and 4. The highest number must be taken as the first character of the code for the multi-load and therefore the first character will be 4. The bullet in •2S is not assigned to the mixed load because other EACs do not include a bullet. '''2nd Character (Letter):''' The second character for the EAC for each of the three substances is Y, S and W. Taking the Y along the top row of the chart and the S along the left hand column, the intersection is at Y and therefore the character for the first two substances would be Y. This resultant character (Y) is then taken along the top row and the character for the third substance (W) is taken along the left hand column. The intersection point is now W. The second character of the code for the three substances is therefore W. '''Letter ‘E’:''' The third substance has an ‘E’ as a third character and therefore the multi-load must also have an ‘E’. The resultant Hazchem Code for the three substances carried as a multi-load will therefore be 4WE. == See also == * [[Dangerous goods|Hazmat]] * [[NFPA 704]] * [[ADR (treaty)|ADR]]—the equivalent system used for identifying dangerous goods in mainland [[Europe]] * [[Hazardous Materials Identification System]] == References == == External links == * [https://d18hkfaesybon0.cloudfront.net/ncec/media/assets/downloads/ncec-emergency-action-code-list-2017.pdf NCEC Dangerous Goods Emergency Action List 2017] * [http://the-ncec.com/assets/Resources/EAC-Dangerous-Goods-List-2013.pdf Download EAC List 2013]{{Dead link|date=November 2018}} * [http://www.hazchem.freeuk.com/panel.htm Example of UK Hazchem Panel with Hazchem Emergency Action Code (EAC)]{{Dead link|date=November 2018}} * [http://www.hazchem.freeuk.com/index.htm General 'Hazchem Information for UK Emergency Services' Site]{{Dead link|date=November 2018}} * [https://web.archive.org/web/20070610152700/http://www.communities.gov.uk/pub/860/DangerousGoodsEmergencyActionCodeList2005PDF777Kb_id1124860.pdf Dangerous Goods Emergency Action Code List] * [http://tech.groups.yahoo.com/group/DangerousGoods/ Dangerous Goods-Hazmat Group], a Yahoo-hosted global network for discussion of dangerous goods and hazardous materials storage and handling issues. [[Category:Symbols]] [[Category:Safety codes]] [[Category:Standards of the United Kingdom]] [[Category:Hazards]] [[Category:Warning systems]]

{{Use dmy dates|date=October 2016}} {{Use British English|date=October 2016}} '''Holly Brockwell''', born {{birth date and age|1985|12|13}}<ref>https://twitter.com/holly/status/979126623399301120</ref> is an English [[Technology journalism|technology journalist]], [[Copywriting|copywriter]] and the founder of the tech site ''Gadgette''. She has also written columns for ''[[Gizmodo]]'', the [[BBC]], ''[[The Guardian]]'' and other media outlets.
== Early life == Brockwell is from [[Nottingham]]<ref name=Notts>{{Cite news|url=http://www.nottinghampost.com/scottish-referendum-tweet-nottingham-resident/story-22952712-detail/story.html |title=Scottish referendum: How a tweet from a Nottingham resident took the Twittersphere by storm |date=2014-09-19 |newspaper=[[Nottingham Post]] |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141210112425/http://www.nottinghampost.com/scottish-referendum-tweet-nottingham-resident/story-22952712-detail/story.html |archivedate=2014-12-10 }}</ref> and currently lives in London. She originally hoped to study computer science at university, but instead took a degree in English and became an advertising copywriter and an assistant reviewer and then an editor at ''ShinyShiny'', a women's technology website.<ref name=Look>{{cite news |author=zroll |url=http://www.look.co.uk/list-for-life/people/what-its-like-to-be-a-woman-in-tech-media-11367 |title='What it’s like to be a tech journalist' |type=interview |newspaper=[[Look (UK magazine)|Look]] |date=2015-12-09 |accessdate=2017-08-01 }}</ref>
== NHS sterilization denial == In 2012 Brockwell requested the ability to be [[Sterilization (medicine)|sterilized]] from the United Kingdom's [[National Health Service]]. She was denied due to her age,<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/magazine-34521525 |title=100 Women 2015: Desperate not to have children |date=2015-11-22|work=Magazine |publisher=[[BBC]] |access-date=2017-08-01 }}</ref> which according to the NHS is common practice because surgeons prefer to wait until prospective patients are at least 30 years of age and have had children.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.nhs.uk/conditions/contraception-guide/pages/female-sterilisation.aspx#Who|title=Female sterilisation - Contraception guide |website=NHS Choices |publisher=National Health Service |access-date=2017-06-03}}</ref> At the end of March 2016, after turning 30, she was granted permission for the procedure.<ref>{{cite news |first=Holly |last=Blott |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/femail/article-3513800/Holly-Brockwell-reveals-happiness-wins-four-year-battle-sterilised-Morning.html |title=Woman, 30, defends being sterilised after winning four year battle with NHS |newspaper=[[The Daily Mail]] |date=2016-03-29 }}</ref>
== Blogging and ''Gadgette'' == In 2012 Brockwell blogged about an advertising agency and its campaign about benefit schemes for their staff <ref>{{cite web |first=Holly |last=Brockwell |url=https://hollybrockwell.com/2012/09/05/ad-agency-laughs-at-people-on-benefits/|title=Ad agency laughs at people on benefits |website=HollyBrockwell.com |date=2012-09-05 |publisher=|accessdate=2017-08-01 }}</ref> which sparked controversy and negative publicity.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.decisionmarketing.co.uk/news/iris-faces-uproar-over-chav-parody|title=Iris faces uproar over 'chav' parody |publisher=Decision Marketing |date=2012-09-07 |accessdate=2017-08-01 }}</ref> The agency accused Brockwell of libel but later apologised.
The next year Brockwell sparked controversy again after writing about a 2013 [[Hyundai]] advert that was later withdrawn.<ref>{{cite news |first=Emily |last=Dugan |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/media/advertising/hyundai-pulls-viral-zero-emission-car-ad-featuring-man-attempting-suicide-8588650.html |title=Hyundai pulls viral zero emission car ad featuring man attempting suicide |newspaper=[[The Independent]] |date=2013-04-25 |accessdate=2017-08-01 }}</ref>
In 2015 Brockwell started her own women’s tech site called ''Gadgette'' in order to tackle the apparent condescending and discriminating attitudes towards women in the technology industry. The launch of the website faced backlash, according to an op-ed by Brockwell.<ref>{{cite news |first=Holly |last=Brockwell |url=https://www.theguardian.com/media-network/2015/jul/22/sexism-tech-industry-womens-site |title=I've been viciously attacked for daring to start a women's tech site |newspaper=[[The Guardian]] |type=opinion |date=2015-07-22 }}</ref>
In the summer of 2017 she was the first journalist hired by [[Jimmy Wales]] for his new commercial news venture, [[Wikitribune]].<ref>{{cite news |first=Kitty |last=Knowles |url=https://www.thememo.com/2017/07/07/wikitribune-inside-the-media-mashup-waging-war-on-fake-news/ |title=WikiTribune: Inside the media mashup waging war on fake news |website=The Memo |date=2017-07-07 |accessdate=2017-08-01 }}</ref> Her last day with that publication was November 17, 2017.<ref>Brockwell, Holly. [https://archive.org/details/171117BrockwellLastday "Last Day at WikiTribune Twitter Announcement,"] Twitter.com, Nov. 17, 2017.</ref>
== Awards == In 2015 she won the SheSays Award for The Drum Woman of the Year.<ref>{{cite web |first=Katie |last=McQuater |url=http://www.thedrum.com/news/2015/11/13/editor-chief-tech-publication-gadgette-holly-brockwell-named-drum-woman-year-shesays |title=Editor-in-chief of tech publication Gadgette Holly Brockwell named The Drum Woman of the Year at SheSays Awards |website=The Drum |date=2015-11-13 }}</ref>
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links== *[https://hollybrockwell.com/ Personal website]
